intro: Psephellus appendicigerus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its spread. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
